problem.markdown:
>>Q1. The accuracy depends upon?<< ( ) Precise instruments ( ) Precise methods ( ) Good planning (x) All of the above ( ) None of the above
>>Q2. In a 5 m telescopic staff, the length of lower box is<< ( ) 1 meter ( ) 1.5 meter ( ) 1.73 meter ( ) 1.8 meter (x) 2.0 meter
>>Q3. The cross hair is made of<< ( ) Threads from the cocoon of the brown spider ( ) Fine platinum wire ( ) Filaments of silk ( ) Etching on glass (x) Any of above
>>Q4. The magnification of a telescope depends upon<< ( ) Focal length of objective lens ( ) Focal length of eye-piece (x) Ratio of fical length of objective lens/focal length of eye piece ( ) Sum of focal length of objective lens and focal length of eye piece ( ) (1/focal length of objective lens)+(1/focal length of eye piece)
>>Q5. The cross-hair in a telescope are fitted<< (x) In front of eye piece ( ) At the centre of the telescope ( ) In the objective glass ( ) At the optical centre of eye piece ( ) Anywhere between objective and eye piece
>>Q6. Which one of the following may be termed as instrumental error in levelling<< ( ) Error due to sluggish bubble ( ) Error due to imperfect adjustment ( ) Error due to movement of objective slide ( ) Error due to defective joint (x) All of the above
>>Q7. The angle of field of the telescope<< ( ) Increases as the magnifying power increase ( ) Increases as the distance between eye piece and object increases (x) Increases as the size of the eye piece increases ( ) Depends in the size of the object glass
>>Q8. A fixed point of reference of known elevation is known as<< (x) Bench Mark ( ) Datum ( ) Change point ( )Station point
>>Q9. The levelling of instrument is done so that<< (x) Vertical axis is truly vertical ( ) Line of sight is truly horizontal ( ) Optical axis is truly horizontal ( ) Effect of curvature of earth is nullified
>>Q10. When the bubble of the level tube of a level, is central<< (x) Line of sight is horizontal ( ) axis of the telescope is horizontal ( ) line of collimation is horizontal ( ) geometrical axis of the telescope is horizontal
>>Q11. While viewing through a level telescope and moving the eye slightly, a relative movement occurs between the image of the levelling staff and the cross hairs. The instrument is<< (x) correctly focussed ( ) not correctly focused ( ) said to have parallex ( ) free from parallex

problem.p: Q3. The cross hair is made of

choicegroup.label: Q3. The cross hair is made of
choicegroup.choice: Threads from the cocoon of the brown spider

problem.p: Q4. The magnification of a telescope depends upon

choicegroup.label: Q4. The magnification of a telescope depends upon
choicegroup.choice: Ratio of fical length of objective lens/focal length of eye piece
Sum of focal length of objective lens and focal length of eye piece
(1/focal length of objective lens)+(1/focal length of eye piece)

problem.p: Q5. The cross-hair in a telescope are fitted

choicegroup.label: Q5. The cross-hair in a telescope are fitted
choicegroup.choice: At the centre of the telescope
At the optical centre of eye piece
Anywhere between objective and eye piece

problem.p: Q6. Which one of the following may be termed as instrumental error in levelling

choicegroup.label: Q6. Which one of the following may be termed as instrumental error in levelling
choicegroup.choice: Error due to movement of objective slide

problem.p: Q7. The angle of field of the telescope

choicegroup.label: Q7. The angle of field of the telescope
choicegroup.choice: Increases as the magnifying power increase
Increases as the distance between eye piece and object increases
Increases as the size of the eye piece increases
Depends in the size of the object glass

choicegroup.label: Q9. The levelling of instrument is done so that
choicegroup.choice: Line of sight is truly horizontal
Effect of curvature of earth is nullified

problem.p: Q10. When the bubble of the level tube of a level, is central

choicegroup.label: Q10. When the bubble of the level tube of a level, is central
choicegroup.choice: axis of the telescope is horizontal
geometrical axis of the telescope is horizontal
